docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, March 21. -- Judge William Lindsay, Senator from Kentucky, and recognized as one of the ablest lawyers in the Senate, reintroduced the Torrey Bankruptcy bill on the last day of the session of the Senate of the Fifty-fourth Congress.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 21. -- Judge William Lindsay, Senator from Kentucky, and recognized as one of the ablest lawyers in the Senate, reintroduced the Torrey Bankruptcy bill on the last day of the session of the Senate of the Fifty-fourth Congress.

headline.main: LINDSAY ON BANKRUPTCY; The Kentucky Senator Explains Why He Is Urging the Passage of the Torrey Bill. THINKS IT COMPLETE AND FAIR. Provisions as to Courts, Officers, Bankrupts, Creditors, and Estates -- To Simplify the Question -- Philosophy of Credits.

docs.snippet: Lieut. RICHARD MITCHELL, United States Navy, has in the April number of Harper's Magazine a most interesting article on "Our Trade with South America, with Special Reference to Brazil and the River Plate Republics." If is the fruit of long and varied...
docs.lead_paragraph: Lieut. RICHARD MITCHELL, United States Navy, has in the April number of Harper's Magazine a most interesting article on "Our Trade with South America, with Special Reference to Brazil and the River Plate Republics." If is the fruit of long and varied observation in the region discussed, and is marked throughout by shrewd sense as well as keen interest in the commercial prosperity of the United States.
docs.abstract: Our Trade with South America, Especially Brazil

docs.snippet: If all the Christian Endeavorers in New York City should turn out in one big procession they would make quite a respectable army. The quota of nearly seven full regiments would be included in this muster, and the scene would be rendered still more...
docs.lead_paragraph: If all the Christian Endeavorers in New York City should turn out in one big procession they would make quite a respectable army. The quota of nearly seven full regiments would be included in this muster, and the scene would be rendered still more picturesque if to it were added the various society and district banners and the blue and white colors of the New York City Union.
docs.abstract: New York City Union; Membership, Officers, &c.
